conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful questions and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

At the moment, the main factor preventing an offer is that we are keeping our remaining place available while we see whether any higher-priority families (on our admissions priority order) apply to Nursery_C in the coming rounds. Because our priority ranking is fixed, additional documents generally won’t change your position relative to other families; however, having your basic details ready (start date needs, schedule constraints, and confirmation that you can accept immediately) is still helpful for quick processing if we are able to move forward.

A realistic scenario in which we could offer you the place is: if no higher-priority family applies (or if they apply but do not proceed) as the allocation progresses. If that happens, we would be able to consider extending an offer to the strongest remaining interested family.

If you would like to remain actively considered, please feel free to message us again with an [APPLY] in a future round; we will continue to reassess based on who is still in the market at that time.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
